channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar is dead. Can Israel seal a hostage deal now?
item.description: The leader of Hamas, Yahya Sinwar, is dead, the Israeli military confirmed. This leaves behind very important questions about what is next for the group and whether a cease-fire deal could progress.
item.content:encoded:
The leader of Hamas, Yahya Sinwar, is dead, the Israeli military confirmed. This leaves behind very important questions about what is next for the group and whether a cease-fire deal could progress.

(Image credit: Adel Hana)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: PHOTOS: How 9 families cope when they can't afford 3 healthy meals a day for the kids
item.description: "Severe child food poverty" is on the rise, affecting 181 million young kids. Here's how families cope when their kids are hungry and they can't afford to put 3 nutritious meals a day on the table.
item.content:encoded:
"Severe child food poverty" is on the rise, affecting 181 million young kids. Here's how families cope when their kids are hungry and they can't afford to put 3 nutritious meals a day on the table.

(Image credit: Sope Adelaja for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Emily Sohn

item.title: Mortgage rates were supposed to come down. Instead, they're rising. Here's why
item.description: Mortgage rates are ticking up even after the Federal Reserve has started cutting interest rates. Here's why, and where rates — and home sales — could go from here.
item.content:encoded:
Mortgage rates are ticking up even after the Federal Reserve has started cutting interest rates. Here's why, and where rates — and home sales — could go from here.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Laurel Wamsley

item.title: A Canadian former Olympic snowboarder is wanted in a U.S. drug trafficking case
item.description: A former Olympic snowboarder for Canada has been charged with running a drug trafficking ring that shipped vast amounts of cocaine across the Americas and killed four people, authorities said.
item.content:encoded:
A former Olympic snowboarder for Canada has been charged with running a drug trafficking ring that shipped vast amounts of cocaine across the Americas and killed four people, authorities said.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Barbed wire, high fences: some election spots in Arizona close, but others step up
item.description: Some election locations in Arizona are shutting their doors in the face of security threats — but others are expanding their footprint.
item.content:encoded:
Some election locations in Arizona are shutting their doors in the face of security threats — but others are expanding their footprint.

(Image credit: Ash Ponders for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: This week's news quiz has skeletons (though sadly not the political kind)
item.description: If you've paid attention to incoming presidents and incoming pandas you can ace at least half of this week's quiz.
item.content:encoded: If you've paid attention to incoming presidents and incoming pandas you can ace at least half of this week's quiz.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: AI-generated images have become a new form of propaganda this election season
item.description: This election cycle, AI-generated images have proliferated on social media platforms after politically charged news events. They often spread partisan narratives rather than facts.
item.content:encoded: This election cycle, AI-generated images have proliferated on social media platforms after politically charged news events. They often spread partisan narratives rather than facts.
item.dc:creator: Huo Jingnan

item.title: Emo music not only still exists — it's thriving
item.description: If you had any doubts, we can clear them up now. Emo music not only still exists — it's thriving.
item.content:encoded:
If you had any doubts, we can clear them up now. Emo music not only still exists — it's thriving.

(Image credit: Dustin Franz for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Brianna Scott

item.title: King Charles III's visit rekindles Australia's debate on ending ties to the British monarchy
item.description: While the welcome will be warm, Australia's national and state leaders want the royals removed from their constitution.
item.content:encoded:
While the welcome will be warm, Australia's national and state leaders want the royals removed from their constitution.

(Image credit: Kin Cheung)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Alabama executes man who killed 5 and asked to be put to death
item.description: Alabama executed a man Thursday who admitted to killing five people with an ax and gun during a drug-fueled rampage in 2016 and dropped his appeals and asked to be put to death.
item.content:encoded:
Alabama executed a man Thursday who admitted to killing five people with an ax and gun during a drug-fueled rampage in 2016 and dropped his appeals and asked to be put to death.

(Image credit: AP/)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
